properties.title: Amazônia Minada: pedidos de mineração dentro de áreas protegidas recebem aval do governo
properties.content: Unidades de conservação nacionais de proteção integral da Amazônia abrigam 441 registros de atividade mineradora.
properties.excerpt: Unidades de conservação nacionais de proteção integral da Amazônia abrigam 441 registros de atividade mineradora.

properties.title: Década perdida: se disparó la tasa de deforestación de Amazonia de Brasil
properties.content: (Português) Taxa oficial de desmatamento divulgada por INPE tem alta de 29,5%. Proporção de grandes áreas derrubadas (superiores a 500 hectares) também é a mais elevada em dez anos.
properties.excerpt: (Português) Taxa oficial de desmatamento divulgada por INPE tem alta de 29,5%. Proporção de grandes áreas derrubadas (superiores a 500 hectares) também é a mais elevada em dez anos.

properties.title: Peixe-zebra do Xingu ainda na rota do tráfico internacional de espécies ameaçadas
properties.content: Mesmo com sua captura proibida há 15 anos, o raro acari-zebra do rio Xingu ainda é traficado através de aeroportos amazônicos.
properties.excerpt: Mesmo com sua captura proibida há 15 anos, o raro acari-zebra do rio Xingu ainda é traficado através de aeroportos amazônicos.

properties.title: Pescadores formam aliança para proteger espécies da Amazônia
properties.content: Série de encontros ao longo de 2019 reuniu mais de 100 pescadores para articular redes de monitoramento comunitário de 20 espécies de peixes migratórios
properties.excerpt: Série de encontros ao longo de 2019 reuniu mais de 100 pescadores para articular redes de monitoramento comunitário de 20 espécies de peixes migratórios

properties.title: Autoridades indígenas são protagonistas em congresso latino-americano de áreas protegidas
properties.content: Mais de 2 mil especialistas em conservação e uso sustentável se reúnem até dia 17 no Peru para avaliar e projetar o papel das áreas protegidas no continente
properties.excerpt: Mais de 2 mil especialistas em conservação e uso sustentável se reúnem até dia 17 no Peru para avaliar e projetar o papel das áreas protegidas no continente

properties.title: Número de invasões de terras indígenas é o maior dos últimos três anos
properties.content: Sob Bolsonaro, invasões de terras indígenas superam 2018. De janeiro a setembro, Conselho Indigenista contabilizou 160 ataques, 51 a mais que em todo o ano passado. Foto de abertura: Queimada nos limites da Terra Indígena Karipuna em Rondônia Por Gustavo Faleiros e Fábio Nascimento O mais recente balanço lançado pelo Conselho Indigenista Missionário, o Cimi, […]

properties.title: Satélites de la NASA muestran cómo arde la Amazonia de Brasil
properties.content: (Português) Incêndios na Amazônia cresceram 38% este ano. Sete das cidades com mais incêndios também estão na lista daquelas com maior desmatamento
properties.excerpt: (Português) Incêndios na Amazônia cresceram 38% este ano. Sete das cidades com mais incêndios também estão na lista daquelas com maior desmatamento

properties.title: “Brasil não sabe quanto está pescando na Amazônia”
properties.content: Um dos mais renomados especialistas em peixes da Amazônia, o pesquisador Ronaldo Barthem aponta caminhos para o país retomar o controle de seus estoques pesqueiros.
properties.excerpt: Um dos mais renomados especialistas em peixes da Amazônia, o pesquisador Ronaldo Barthem aponta caminhos para o país retomar o controle de seus estoques pesqueiros.

properties.title: Os Sateré-Mawé retomam terras ancestrais ameaçadas por madeireiros e grileiros
properties.content: Em uma região historicamente ocupada pelo povo Sateré-Mawé, os indígenas reivindicam junto à Fundação Nacional do Índio (Funai) a correção dos limites da Terra Indígena Andirá-Marau.
properties.excerpt: Em uma região historicamente ocupada pelo povo Sateré-Mawé, os indígenas reivindicam junto à Fundação Nacional do Índio (Funai) a correção dos limites da Terra Indígena Andirá-Marau.

properties.title: Ritual da Tucandeira: grupo indígena se prepara para reaver terras ancestrais
properties.content: Em fevereiro, uma equipe de reportagem viajou para a Amazônia, passando tempo com os Sateré-Mawé, documentando sua cultura e conflitos de longa data com empresas de mineração e grileiros. Esta série analisa as novas ameaças impostas aos grupos Sateré e indígenas em todo o Brasil, à medida que são ameaçados pelas políticas favoráveis ​​aos ruralistas […]
properties.excerpt: Em fevereiro, uma equipe de reportagem viajou para a Amazônia, passando tempo com os Sateré-Mawé, documentando sua cultura e conflitos de longa data com empresas de mineração e grileiros. properties.title: No Maranhão, juiz autoriza destruição de casas em comunidade afetada por megaporto
properties.content: Decisão judicial deu sinal verde para a derrubada de casas na comunidade do Cajueiro, onde moradores sofrem impactos ligados à construção de um megaporto

properties.title: Contra investida ruralista, os Sateré-Mawé defendem seu território e cultura
properties.content: Em fevereiro, uma equipe de Mongabay visitou o povo Sateré-Mawé, na divisa do Amazonas com o Pará, e documentou sua cultura e os conflitos de longa data com empresas de mineração e grileiros. Esta série analisa as novas ameaças impostas aos Sateré e grupos indígenas de todo o Brasil pelas políticas favoráveis aos ruralistas em […]

properties.title: Operação cerca-índio
properties.content: As invasões aos territórios indígenas em Rondônia não são algo novo. Mas dados sobre episódios de violência no campo, como assassinatos de lideranças e ameaças a comunidades revelam o recrudescimento desta briga.
properties.excerpt: As invasões aos territórios indígenas em Rondônia não são algo novo. Mas dados sobre episódios de violência no campo, como assassinatos de lideranças e ameaças a comunidades revelam o recrudescimento desta briga.

properties.title: Sitiados pelo progresso
properties.content: A obra de um porto para transporte de grãos, combustíveis e minérios une Brasil e China a casos de violência contra populações rurais
properties.excerpt: A obra de um porto para transporte de grãos, combustíveis e minérios une Brasil e China a casos de violência contra populações rurais

properties.title: Barragens no Rio Madeira impedem migração do bagre maratonista, diz estudo
properties.content: O monitoramento independente de uma população de grandes bagres no rio Madeira, importante afluente do Amazonas, confirma que duas usinas hidrelétricas praticamente impediram a migração da espécie que faz a mais longa migração de água doce conhecida no mundo
properties.excerpt: O monitoramento independente de uma população de grandes bagres no rio Madeira, importante afluente do Amazonas, confirma que duas usinas hidrelétricas praticamente impediram a migração da espécie que faz a mais longa migração de água doce conhecida no mundo

properties.title: Amazônia perdeu uma cidade de São Paulo nos últimos meses de 2018
properties.content: Segundo dados do Imazon,  houve crescimento de 79% no número de alertas de desmatamento. Maiores altas ocorreram após eleição de Bolsonaro.
properties.excerpt: Segundo dados do Imazon,  houve crescimento de 79% no número de alertas de desmatamento. Maiores altas ocorreram após eleição de Bolsonaro.

properties.title: Photojournalist at Correo del Caroní has been missing for more than six months
properties.content: The family chose not to report so far for fear of retaliation or that the investigations would be halted
properties.excerpt: The family chose not to report so far for fear of retaliation or that the investigations would be halted

properties.title: El río Amazonas le está robando agua al río Orinoco
properties.content: (Português) Uma pesquisa indica que o rio que conecta as bacias do Amazonas e do Orinoco está cedendo. Quando o desvio se completas, o Amazonas terá roubado 40 mil quilômetros quadrados das cabeceiras do Orinoco.
properties.excerpt: (Português) Uma pesquisa indica que o rio que conecta as bacias do Amazonas e do Orinoco está cedendo. Quando o desvio se completas, o Amazonas terá roubado 40 mil quilômetros quadrados das cabeceiras do Orinoco.

properties.title: Plataformas e aplicativos facilitam a participação da sociedade em pesquisas e conservação da biodiversidade
properties.content: Engajamento para ciência na Amazônia vai do analógico ao digital, mostraram 15 ONGs reunidas no Congresso Brasileiro de Unidades de Conservação.
properties.excerpt: Engajamento para ciência na Amazônia vai do analógico ao digital, mostraram 15 ONGs reunidas no Congresso Brasileiro de Unidades de Conservação.

properties.title: Cientistas se unem a comunidades em rede de pesquisa colaborativa
properties.content: Reunião do projeto Ciência Cidadã para a Amazônia em Iquitos, Peru, faz o primeiro teste de aplicativo para monitoramento de peixes migratórios. InfoAmazonia vai acompanhar os resultados de projetos-piloto nos próximos meses

properties.title: Papa anuncia Sínodo para la Amazonia
properties.content: Antes de rezar la oración mariana del Ángelus, el Papa hizo este domingo 15 de octubre un anuncio esperado por las comunidades religiosas pan amazónicas. Después de saludar a todos los peregrinos y delegaciones oficiales de Brasil, Francia, Italia, México, Orden de Malta y España, Francisco dijo en italiano: «Atendiendo el deseo de algunas Conferencias […]

properties.title: Este casal construiu uma comunidade sustentável na Amazônia
properties.content: Seu França e Dona Lucimar encontraram, na criação da unidade de conservação onde fica sua vila, os meios para educar seus 12 filhos

properties.title: Degradação ameaça a vida na floresta

properties.title: O homem que quer levar a medicina indígena do Alto Rio Negro para todo mundo
properties.content: João Paulo Barreto é um dos mais sonoros porta-vozes da medicina e dos conhecimentos indígenas. Sob sua coordenação, foi inaugurado o primeiro Centro de Medicina Indígena da Amazônia, em Manaus
properties.excerpt: João Paulo Barreto é um dos mais sonoros porta-vozes da medicina e dos conhecimentos indígenas. Sob sua coordenação, foi inaugurado o primeiro Centro de Medicina Indígena da Amazônia, em Manaus

properties.title: Com drones, pesquisadores querem conhecer melhor os botos da Amazônia
properties.content: As quatro espécies que habitam a região ainda são um mistério. Não há estimativas confiáveis da quantidade de botos existentes e pouco se sabe de seu comportamento

properties.title: Indígenas da Amazônia venezuelana prometem resistir contra Maduro
properties.content: Megaprojeto do governo da Venezuela para conceder mais de 100 mil km² da Amazônia a mineradoras, Arco Mineiro do Orinoco é rejeitado por lideranças indígenas locais, que se recusam a deixar a região

properties.title: Indígenas da Amazônia articulam independência territorial
properties.content: Desapontados com governos de esquerda, povos esperam mudanças em modelo "depredador, patriarcal e racista" dos nove países da bacia
properties.excerpt: Desapontados com governos de esquerda, povos esperam mudanças em modelo "depredador, patriarcal e racista" dos nove países da bacia

properties.excerpt: Populações do Acre enfrentam enchentes extremas e se adaptam às mudanças climáticas

properties.title: Manaus deve ter uma das maiores cheias da história em 2017
properties.content: Alerta da CPRM deve ser divulgado nesta sexta-feira e, ao que tudo indica, nível do Rio Negro deve passar dos 29 metros
properties.excerpt: Alerta da CPRM deve ser divulgado nesta sexta-feira e, ao que tudo indica, nível do Rio Negro deve passar dos 29 metros

properties.title: Três anos depois, atingidos por cheia do Rio Madeira seguem abandonados
properties.content: Reportagem em vídeo do InfoAmazonia mostra que ribeirinhos de Porto Velho (RO) continuam sem acesso à pesca, sua principal fonte de renda, e moradia digna
properties.excerpt: Reportagem em vídeo do InfoAmazonia mostra que ribeirinhos de Porto Velho (RO) continuam sem acesso à pesca, sua principal fonte de renda, e moradia digna

properties.title: Dinheiro dá em árvore? Agricultura familiar e reflorestamento da Amazônia
properties.content: Entrevistas com produtores rurais, feitas em viagem do documentarista Márcio Isensee à Alta Floresta, norte do Mato Grosso, explicam a opção pelo modelo da agrofloresta. A técnica consiste em fazer o reflorestamento de áreas desmatadas mesclando espécies nativas com outras de valor comercial ou essenciais para a segurança alimentar.
properties.excerpt: Entrevistas com produtores rurais, feitas em viagem do documentarista Márcio Isensee à Alta Floresta, norte do Mato Grosso, explicam a opção pelo modelo da agrofloresta. A técnica consiste em fazer o reflorestamento de áreas desmatadas mesclando espécies nativas com outras de valor comercial ou essenciais para a segurança alimentar.

properties.title: Às margens do rio Madeira, Porto Velho enfrentou insegurança hídrica na seca
properties.content: Desde 1968, quando o CPRM iniciou o monitoramento hidrológico em Porto Velho, nunca havia sido registrado um nível tão baixo da água do Madeira no mês de agosto. A seca trouxe à tona os pedrais e bancos de areia que foram vistos ao longo do manancial, deixando a navegação na hidrovia muito perigosa.
properties.excerpt: Desde 1968, quando o CPRM iniciou o monitoramento hidrológico em Porto Velho, nunca havia sido registrado um nível tão baixo da água do Madeira no mês de agosto. A seca trouxe à tona os pedrais e bancos de areia que foram vistos ao longo do manancial, deixando a navegação na hidrovia muito perigosa.

properties.title: Imazon detecta aumento de 69% no desmatamento em setembro de 2016
properties.content: Em setembro de 2016, o Sistema de Alertas de Desmatamento (SAD) do Imazon detectou 387 quilômetros quadrados de desmatamento na Amazônia Legal.

properties.title: Dams inevitably result in species decline, losses on reservoir islands
properties.content: Global dam study: reservoir islands shouldn’t be counted as conservation areas by developers. Island isolation inevitably leads to extinctions, ecosystem instability. by Claire Salisbury Hydropower development is booming, with controversial projects unfolding across the Americas, Africa, Asia and Europe. Though often presented as a green renewable energy option, dams can cause a litany of negative […]

Though often presented as a green renewable energy option, dams can cause a litany of negative […]

properties.title: Madre de Dios, Perú:  La  carretera  que  corta  el  corazón  de  la  Amazonia
properties.content: Ojo-Publico.com recorrió los bosques de Madre de Dios y verificó que la ilegal carretera promovida por el gobernador regional, ha sido ampliada.

properties.content: Documentário mostra o patrimônio cultural dos povos indígenas Tsimane` Mosetén que ancestralmente tem protegido as florestas do Parque Nacional Madidi e da Reserva da Biosfera Pilon Lajas.

properties.title: Caravan in defense of the Tapajós River warnings dams in Para state, Brazil
properties.content: The event was a mobilization  held by social movements of organizations of Pará municipalities of Santarém, Itaituba, Jacareacanga and Aveiro. These organizations are unified in the Tapajós Vivo movement, based in Santarém.
properties.excerpt: The event was a mobilization  held by social movements of organizations of Pará municipalities of Santarém, Itaituba, Jacareacanga and Aveiro. These organizations are unified in the Tapajós Vivo movement, based in Santarém.

properties.title: Peru: Two oil spills impacted 4425 square meters of Amazon territory
properties.content: The total area of the Amazon territory that was affected by two spills that took place in August in New Alianza, in the Amazon region of Loreto, Peru, has an extension of more than three Olympic swimming pools.
properties.excerpt: The total area of the Amazon territory that was affected by two spills that took place in August in New Alianza, in the Amazon region of Loreto, Peru, has an extension of more than three Olympic swimming pools.

properties.title: Fires threaten Amazon forests and Brazil’s emission targets
properties.content: Fires raging across Amazonia could reach unprecedented levels by October if authorities do not clamp down on the practice of starting them in order to clear and maintain pastureland, according to Alberto Setzer, coordinator of fire monitoring at Brazil’s National Institute for Space Research (INPE). The number of fire outbreaks nationwide is already 57% higher […]
properties.excerpt: Fires raging across Amazonia could reach unprecedented levels by October if authorities do not clamp down on the practice of starting them in order to clear and maintain pastureland, according to Alberto Setzer, coordinator of fire monitoring at Brazil’s National Institute for Space Research (INPE). The number of fire outbreaks nationwide is already 57% higher […]

properties.title: It’s coming the canoeing route “Canoa Bye Bye Xingu”, in Brazil

properties.title: Brazil: Ibama denies licensing São Luiz do Tapajós hydroelectric dam
properties.content: Recommendations by the Federal Public Ministry, the indigenous agency (FUNAI) and technicians of the environmental agency paralyze the construction of the hydroelectric powerplant project planned for the Tapajós river.
properties.excerpt: Recommendations by the Federal Public Ministry, the indigenous agency (FUNAI) and technicians of the environmental agency paralyze the construction of the hydroelectric powerplant project planned for the Tapajós river.

properties.title: Matt Hansen: conheça o geógrafo que monitora o desmatamento global
properties.content: O projeto Global Forest Change, desenvolvido por Matthew Hansen, da Universidade de Maryland, monitora as florestas usando algoritmos para distinguir mudanças na cobertura florestal através de imagens de satélite.

properties.title: Peru: United Cacao project is in territory classified as forest land
properties.content: According to studies by the Ministry of Agriculture, most United Cacao deforestation occurred in soils suitable for forestry, which is not permitted.

properties.title: Research shows that Colombian Amazon is contaminated by mercury
properties.content: Research has determined that the mercury level exceeds up to 87 times the level permitted by the Colombian State.

properties.title: Com  aumento  da  seca,  queimadas  avançam  pelo  Brasil
properties.content: O número de queimadas, como sempre, se eleva nesta época. InfoAmazonia mostra um mapa com a última contagem feita pelo sensor de satélite VIIRS, que possui maior resolução e revelou mais de 6000 focos de calor no dia 26 de julho.
properties.excerpt: O número de queimadas, como sempre, se eleva nesta época. InfoAmazonia mostra um mapa com a última contagem feita pelo sensor de satélite VIIRS, que possui maior resolução e revelou mais de 6000 focos de calor no dia 26 de julho.

properties.title: With  increase  of  drought,  fires  advance  in  Brazil
properties.content: O número de queimadas, como sempre, se eleva nesta época. InfoAmazonia mostra um mapa com a última contagem feita pelo sensor de satélite VIIRS, que possui maior resolução e revelou mais de 6000 focos de calor no dia 26 de julho.
properties.excerpt: O número de queimadas, como sempre, se eleva nesta época. InfoAmazonia mostra um mapa com a última contagem feita pelo sensor de satélite VIIRS, que possui maior resolução e revelou mais de 6000 focos de calor no dia 26 de julho.

properties.title: Peru presents “Route to Tambopata” to promote private conservation
properties.content: It is a campaign to promote tourism and conservation in Madre de Dios by the Private Conservation Areas in the region near the Tambopata National Reserve.
properties.excerpt: It is a campaign to promote tourism and conservation in Madre de Dios by the Private Conservation Areas in the region near the Tambopata National Reserve.

properties.title: Peruvian indigenous peoples expel illegal miners from its territory
properties.content: Indigenous Wampis conducted an operation against dozens of illegal miners who contaminated with mercury and cyanide the Santiago river basin, in the Amazon region.
properties.excerpt: Indigenous Wampis conducted an operation against dozens of illegal miners who contaminated with mercury and cyanide the Santiago river basin, in the Amazon region.

properties.title: Recession can not justify the end of the environmental licensing
properties.content: Constitutional Amendment Proposal suppresses the environmental licensing and will lead to an explosion of mining, hydropower and new roads in the Amazon
properties.excerpt: Constitutional Amendment Proposal suppresses the environmental licensing and will lead to an explosion of mining, hydropower and new roads in the Amazon

properties.title: Ministry of Environment of Peru recognizes a new private conservation area in Loreto
properties.content: The Ministry of Environment in Peru (MINAM) set apart 244.92 hectare area in Loreto as a new Private Conservation Area to conserve the ecosystem for local populations.
properties.excerpt: The Ministry of Environment in Peru (MINAM) set apart 244.92 hectare area in Loreto as a new Private Conservation Area to conserve the ecosystem for local populations.

properties.title: Chestnut trees: the Amazon queens who have no subjects
properties.content: This big tree is disappearing due to deforestation, land development, and the acceleration of urbanization. All of this is occurring without the consideration of conservationism.
properties.excerpt: This big tree is disappearing due to deforestation, land development, and the acceleration of urbanization. All of this is occurring without the consideration of conservationism.

properties.title: Nicinha: a body awaiting the DNA test, a voice that not shut up
properties.content: More than 20 days ago the family recognized a body at the Medical Legal Institute as the Nicinha, and is awaiting liberation to the burial.
properties.excerpt: More than 20 days ago the family recognized a body at the Medical Legal Institute as the Nicinha, and is awaiting liberation to the burial.

properties.title: Hydropower:  a  threat  to  the  Maranon  River  in  Peru?
properties.content: More than 20 hydroelectric plants designed to operate in this Amazon river could displace more than 40,000 people from riverside areas
properties.excerpt: More than 20 hydroelectric plants designed to operate in this Amazon river could displace more than 40,000 people from riverside areas

properties.title: Recently discovered species and indigenous threatened by dam in the Tapajós
properties.content: Eight new mammal species were found in the construction of São Luiz do Tapajós dam, which may become the most controversial hydroelectric project in the history of Brazil.
properties.excerpt: Eight new mammal species were found in the construction of São Luiz do Tapajós dam, which may become the most controversial hydroelectric project in the history of Brazil.

properties.title: Video:  Meet  the  Brazilian  indigenous  issue  in  four  minutes
properties.content: In the following video, we have the contemporary history of Brazilian indigenous issues.
properties.excerpt: In the following video, we have the contemporary history of Brazilian indigenous issues.

properties.title: Peru confirms that deforested area by United Cacao is of forest protection
properties.content: The area that was designed to protect timber forest, was deforested to be used in the development of agricultural activities.
properties.excerpt: The area that was designed to protect timber forest, was deforested to be used in the development of agricultural activities.

properties.title: Research says: Forest intervened does not return to be the same
properties.content: Study presents evidence that 30-year cycle for management of the Amazon is insufficient for forest recovery.
properties.excerpt: Study presents evidence that 30-year cycle for management of the Amazon is insufficient for forest recovery.

properties.title: Hotspot of deforestation in the central jungle of Peru (Huanuco)
properties.content: By 2015, deforestation was calculated at 7,930 hectares (equivalent to 10,865 football fields) in the study area. The main driver would be pasture for cattle.
properties.source: Monitoring of the Andean Amazon Project
properties.excerpt: By 2015, deforestation was calculated at 7,930 hectares (equivalent to 10,865 football fields) in the study area. The main driver would be pasture for cattle.

terms.name: Monitoring of the Andean Amazon Project

properties.title: What is the current situation of environmental activists in Latin America?
properties.content: Honduras just reported the murder of another environmental leader, Lesbia Urquía; while Brazil recently lost the activist Nilce de Souza Magalhães.
properties.excerpt: Honduras just reported the murder of another environmental leader, Lesbia Urquía; while Brazil recently lost the activist Nilce de Souza Magalhães.

properties.title: Evidence for the devastated Amazon and the new maneuver of Melka group
properties.content: Maps and documents confirm that 92% of deforested land in Loreto by US company Melka were forest areas, which show illegal operations to plant cocoa.
properties.excerpt: Maps and documents confirm that 92% of deforested land in Loreto by US company Melka were forest areas, which show illegal operations to plant cocoa.

properties.title: Vehicles used in illegal mining destroyed near Allpahuayo Mishana Reserve
properties.content: Seventeen people arrested and three vehicles destroyed is the result of an operation that was carried out in the buffer zone of the Allpahuayo Mishana National Reserve, located in the Loreto region, Peru.
properties.excerpt: Seventeen people arrested and three vehicles destroyed is the result of an operation that was carried out in the buffer zone of the Allpahuayo Mishana National Reserve, located in the Loreto region, Peru.

properties.title: Peru: New checkpoint in Allpahuayo Mishana and Pacaya Samiria National Reserve
properties.content: The National Service of Natural Protected Areas of Peru with several other public and private institutions installed a checkpoint at the Allpahuayo Mishano National Reserve and the Pacaya Samiria National Reserve.
properties.excerpt: The National Service of Natural Protected Areas of Peru with several other public and private institutions installed a checkpoint at the Allpahuayo Mishano National Reserve and the Pacaya Samiria National Reserve.

properties.title: Marcelândia: dividing frustrations with the Brazilian environmental agency
properties.content: Follow an operation against deforestation in the municipality that occupies the 2nd place in the Mato Grosso list is be faced with smoke, degradation and little chance of finding the culprits
properties.excerpt: Follow an operation against deforestation in the municipality that occupies the 2nd place in the Mato Grosso list is be faced with smoke, degradation and little chance of finding the culprits

properties.title: Chinese construction company plans to build huge dam in the Amazon
properties.content: China Three Gorges, a state enterprise with a history of human rights violation, wants to build the dam São Luiz do Tapajós in Brazil.
properties.excerpt: China Three Gorges, a state enterprise with a history of human rights violation, wants to build the dam São Luiz do Tapajós in Brazil.

properties.title: Brazilian National Forest: Policeman killed in environmental operating
properties.content: Agent was shot in the neck after team suffer ambush. Operation combated illegal logging in the protected area.
properties.excerpt: Agent was shot in the neck after team suffer ambush. Operation combated illegal logging in the protected area.

properties.title: Oil spill in Peru: There were pumping oil in pipeline despite the prohibition
properties.content: The head of Peru’s Ministry of the Environment, Pulgar-Vidal, reveals that the oil spill of June 24 in Loreto was from a pipe that was pumping oil despite the fact that there was a ban.
properties.excerpt: The head of Peru’s Ministry of the Environment, Pulgar-Vidal, reveals that the oil spill of June 24 in Loreto was from a pipe that was pumping oil despite the fact that there was a ban.

properties.title: Forest degradation can have just as drastic an impact on biodiversity as deforestation
properties.content: Deforestation has been the main objective of conversation strategies, but a new study in Nature finds that forest degradation, or the decline in the quality of forests, is also a major threat to biodiversity.
properties.excerpt: Deforestation has been the main objective of conversation strategies, but a new study in Nature finds that forest degradation, or the decline in the quality of forests, is also a major threat to biodiversity.

properties.title: MAAP:  New  gold  mining  border  in  Amazonas  region,  Peru
properties.content: Satellite images confirm that mining is causing deforestation along river Santiago, entering the forests of the region.
properties.source: Monitoring of the Andean Amazon Project
properties.excerpt: Satellite images confirm that mining is causing deforestation along river Santiago, entering the forests of the region.

terms.name: Monitoring of the Andean Amazon Project

properties.title: Brazilian police dismantles band loggers conducted from Sao Paulo
properties.content: Operation reveals group sophistication that worketh deforestation and land grabbing for livestock and soybeans in southwestern Pará state.
properties.excerpt: Operation reveals group sophistication that worketh deforestation and land grabbing for livestock and soybeans in southwestern Pará state.

properties.title: Documentary about social-environmental impact of dams on the Madeira river
properties.content: In the film there are testimonies of people who suffered human rights violations, in addition to unemployment, and forced eviction without compensation of families whose areas were flooded by the dams.
properties.excerpt: In the film there are testimonies of people who suffered human rights violations, in addition to unemployment, and forced eviction without compensation of families whose areas were flooded by the dams.

properties.title: Peruvian oil company confirms a new oil spill in Loreto
properties.content: Petroperú confirms that there is a new oil spill in Loreto, making it the third major oil spill by Petroperú this year.
properties.excerpt: Petroperú confirms that there is a new oil spill in Loreto, making it the third major oil spill by Petroperú this year.

properties.title: Peruvian palm oil firm seeks sale of its Amazon rainforest holdings
properties.content: The Melka Group  is planning to auction off its palm oil holdings in the Amazon. The group has been highly controversial due to its practices of deforestation and complaints by Peruvian courts.
properties.excerpt: The Melka Group  is planning to auction off its palm oil holdings in the Amazon. The group has been highly controversial due to its practices of deforestation and complaints by Peruvian courts.

properties.title: Scientists and conservationists analyze impacts and challenges in Amazon Basin
properties.content: Specialists present results on fisheries, watershed management, environmental pollution, carbon storage and biodiversity in the Amazon.
properties.excerpt: Specialists present results on fisheries, watershed management, environmental pollution, carbon storage and biodiversity in the Amazon.

properties.title: Satellite imagery verify deforestation from illegal mining in the Amazon
properties.content: Monitoring of the Andean Amazon Project (MAAP) indicates that illegal mining activity continues to increase in the Santiago River, Amazonas region, although there are mining concessions.
properties.excerpt: Monitoring of the Andean Amazon Project (MAAP) indicates that illegal mining activity continues to increase in the Santiago River, Amazonas region, although there are mining concessions.

properties.title: From Peru: A critical look to the future of the Amazon basin
properties.content: Director of the Wildlife Conservation Society warns that the construction of a series of hydroelectric dams could affect 30 million people in the Amazon.
properties.excerpt: Director of the Wildlife Conservation Society warns that the construction of a series of hydroelectric dams could affect 30 million people in the Amazon.

properties.title: Nosso impacto na Amazônia é ainda maior do que o imaginado
properties.content: Esforços para conservar espécies tropicais não terão sucesso se não levarem em consideração o controle das perturbações mais comuns causadas pelo homem: a exploração madeireira, os incêndios florestais, e outras.
properties.excerpt: Esforços para conservar espécies tropicais não terão sucesso se não levarem em consideração o controle das perturbações mais comuns causadas pelo homem: a exploração madeireira, os incêndios florestais, e outras.

properties.title: Brazilian state of Pará creates four protected areas in the Amazon
properties.content: They are two Sustainable Development Reserves and two Wildlife Refuges. Two of them are in the area of influence of the hydroelectric Belo Monte.
properties.excerpt: They are two Sustainable Development Reserves and two Wildlife Refuges. Two of them are in the area of influence of the hydroelectric Belo Monte.

properties.title: Projects can remove 7.8 million “Maracana” stadium in the Brazilian Amazon
properties.content: Protected areas may suffer loss of over 6.5 million hectares – an area equivalent to 7.8 million stadiums like the Maracanã – if projects of environmental impact that are in progress in the country are approved.
properties.excerpt: Protected areas may suffer loss of over 6.5 million hectares – an area equivalent to 7.8 million stadiums like the Maracanã – if projects of environmental impact that are in progress in the country are approved.

properties.title: Ironies  that  happen  in  Brazil:  Army  kills  Olympics  Mascot
properties.content: The jaguar was the species chosen as a symbol of the Brazilian delegation. In Manaus, after being displayed in the parade of the Olympic torch, he ran and finished dead.
properties.excerpt: The jaguar was the species chosen as a symbol of the Brazilian delegation. In Manaus, after being displayed in the parade of the Olympic torch, he ran and finished dead.

properties.title: Health officials in Peru: oil spill cleanup workers face ‘poisoning and burns’
properties.content: Workers trying to clean up the oil spill of June 25 in Loreto lacked the equipment to clean up safely. The oil spill threatens the vulnerable community of Barranca which lacks safe drinking water and electricity.
properties.excerpt: Workers trying to clean up the oil spill of June 25 in Loreto lacked the equipment to clean up safely. The oil spill threatens the vulnerable community of Barranca which lacks safe drinking water and electricity.

properties.title: Peru: Oil Spill in the Amazon puts communities at risk
properties.content: A new oil spill raised fears of a deterioration water pollution and fish on which depend indigenous peoples and coastal communities.
properties.excerpt: A new oil spill raised fears of a deterioration water pollution and fish on which depend indigenous peoples and coastal communities.

properties.title: After five months, body of activist murdered was found
properties.content: Nilce de Souza Magalhaes, militant of Movement of People Affected by Dams in Porto Velho, Brazil, was murdered in January and her body had not been found.
properties.excerpt: Nilce de Souza Magalhaes, militant of Movement of People Affected by Dams in Porto Velho, Brazil, was murdered in January and her body had not been found.

properties.title: Amazonian catfish’s 5,000-mile migration endangered by dams
properties.content: More than 400 dams are planned on being built, are being built or have been built in the Amazon Basin. These dams disrupt the impressive migration of Amazonian catfish, a commercially valuable fish and apex predator in the environment.
properties.excerpt: More than 400 dams are planned on being built, are being built or have been built in the Amazon Basin. These dams disrupt the impressive migration of Amazonian catfish, a commercially valuable fish and apex predator in the environment.

properties.title: InfoAmazonia e UFOPA pesquisarão uso de sensores de qualidade d’água
properties.content: Pesquisadores dos Instituto de Ciências e Tecnologia das Águas (ICTA) e de Engenharia e Geociências (IEG) estão se unindo ao InfoAmazonia para investigar aplicações do sensor Mãe d’Água em zonas rurais e urbanas de Santarém, Pará.
properties.excerpt: Pesquisadores dos Instituto de Ciências e Tecnologia das Águas (ICTA) e de Engenharia e Geociências (IEG) estão se unindo ao InfoAmazonia para investigar aplicações do sensor Mãe d’Água em zonas rurais e urbanas de Santarém, Pará.

properties.title: Cusco in waiting: Why obtain a concession for conservation delay so long?
properties.content: In 2013 the Association of Young Conservationists of High Pilcomayo, in Peru, requested a concession to preserve space and ecosystem services in an area in the department of Cusco. They still do not get the concession.
properties.excerpt: In 2013 the Association of Young Conservationists of High Pilcomayo, in Peru, requested a concession to preserve space and ecosystem services in an area in the department of Cusco. They still do not get the concession.

properties.title: Indigenous leaders react to possible demarcations revision in Temer government
properties.content: The Brazilian interim government of President Michel Temer, who took over after the departure of Dilma Rousseff, complete one month on June 12 without setting an agenda for indigenous peoples of the country.
properties.excerpt: The Brazilian interim government of President Michel Temer, who took over after the departure of Dilma Rousseff, complete one month on June 12 without setting an agenda for indigenous peoples of the country.

properties.title: They want to prove that the Madidi is the most biodiverse in the world
properties.content: The Identity Madidi scientific project seeks more data on the ecosystem of the park. In six study sites 900 vertebrate species and 627 butterflies were recorded.
properties.excerpt: The Identity Madidi scientific project seeks more data on the ecosystem of the park. In six study sites 900 vertebrate species and 627 butterflies were recorded.

properties.title: New dams on Madeira River floods cause deforestation
properties.content: The Monitoring Andean Amazon Project presents a new map describing the loss of forest. More than 36,100 hectares of forest have been lost because of flooding by dams, especially the Jirau dam.
properties.source: Monitoring of the Andean Amazon Project
properties.excerpt: The Monitoring Andean Amazon Project presents a new map describing the loss of forest. More than 36,100 hectares of forest have been lost because of flooding by dams, especially the Jirau dam.

terms.name: Monitoring of the Andean Amazon Project
